bioghist.p: The Adelphoi was a Philadelphia area ministers' group who met for discussion and social activities. The society's object as stated in their constitution was to foster social, spiritual, and intellectual fellowship among the members.

scopecontent.p: The minutes included in this collection are from 1945-1971 and 1980-1986. The minutes include meeting announcements and listings of papers read at meetings on a wide variety of topics, such as church unity, politics and evangelism, the church music problem, the relevancy of ministry to business ethics, and philosophers. Also included are membership lists, lists of officers, constitution and by-laws. Additionally there are papers presented to meetings of The Adelphoi, some correspondence to members, cover sheets for talks, a brief history of the group, as well as a poem after Gilbert and Sullivan: "I am the very model of the modern parish minister..."
